str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From a derivative of mneme; to exercise memory, i.e. Recollect; by implication, to punish; also to rehearse.
From the base of posis with enclitic adverb of origin; from which or what place, state, source or cause.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From meta and noieo; to think differently or afterwards, i.e. Reconsider.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From meta and noieo; to think differently or afterwards, i.e. Reconsider.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To come, go.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To set in motion, move, remove, excite, stir up. From kio; to stir, literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A lamp-stand. From luchnos; a lamp-stand.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
